did.abstract: The papers consist of personal, business, and family letters written by members of the Wood family of Littleton, Middlesex, England. Correspondence between Thomas Wood and John Pack, in London, makes up the majority of the papers. There are also letters to Thomas Wood from his sons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Wood Family Papers consist of over one hundred personal, business, and family letters written by members of the Wood family of Littleton, Middlesex, England, 1663-1727. The principal figures in the papers are Thomas Wood, his sons Edward, Robert, and Thomas, his daugher Mary, and John Pack of London.

The elder Thomas Wood's correspondence with John Pack makes up almost two-thirds of the collection. The letters combine business instructions with personal news of the Wood Family. There are also letters to Thomas from his sons (particularly Robert), during and after their studies at Oxford.
The Yale Library purchased the papers from E. Williams in 1922. They were transferred from the Miscellaneous Manuscripts Collection (MS 352) in 1922.
